titleInfo.title: Brought to the Second Municipality Police Prison.

mods.abstract: BROUGHT to the Second Municipality Police Prison -- SARAH, a Mulattress, about twenty years old, five feet three and a half inches high, pock-marked in the face ; says she belongs to Mr. Blackstone. HENRY, a Black, about twenty years old, five feet three and a half inches high, says he belongs to Mr. Jacobs. MILLY, a Griffe, about thirty years old, four feet eleven and a half inches high ; says she belongs to Mr. Peter L. Jore. The owners will please comply with the law respecting them. J. WORALL, Warden. NewOrleans, April 8, 1859. 1aw3w
mods.note: Mr. Blackstone; Mr. Jacobs; Mr. Peter L. Jore

detail.title: New Orleans daily crescent. ([New Orleans, La.]) 1851-1866

mods.accessCondition: Please submit an LSU Special Collections reference ticket at https://askus.lib.lsu.edu/special for any questions or comments about this digital object.

Physical rights are retained by the LSU Libraries. Copyright has expired and the item is therefore in the public domain. Permission to reproduce this image must be requested through the Special Collections Department, Louisiana State University Libraries.
mods.note: Louisiana Runaway Slave Advertisements, 1836-1865, Louisiana Digital Library, Baton Rouge, La.
